body.p: You can either use Bluefin start up kit or setup the development environment by yourself. Follow the instructions from the below section depending on your choice.
body.section: A quick way to have the required development environment and start working on bluefin is to use the Bluefin Startup Kit : https://confluence.paypal.com/cnfl/display/QI/Bluefin+Startup+Kit

section.name: Creating a Java and Eclipse build environment from scratch by yourself
section.p: Follow these instructions for setting up Eclipse and dependent plugins by downloading each component from the Internet.

subsection.name: Download and install both Java and Eclipse

ul.li:
First, download Java (We'd recommend downloading the JDK, any version 5 and up will do), here's a link to the latest Java SE downloads:
http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp (If you already have a development kit installed of version 5 or higher, you can skip this step).
NOTE: We recommend installing the JDK to the root directory, i.e. C:\. Problems come up when defaulting to Program Files.

Download Eclipse (I'd recommend the Eclipse IDE for Java Developers): http://www.eclipse.org/
NOTE: We highly recommend installing Eclipse to the root directory, i.e. C:\. Problems come up when defaulting to Program Files.
Once you've installed Java, and unzipped Eclipse, start up Eclipse

subsection.name: Install Eclipse plugins
subsection.p: Installing Eclipse plugins can be done through the Eclipse toolbar, Help->Software Updates. For Eclipse 3.3+ it's under the Available Software tab, and click Add Site... button to add the URL.

ul.li: The information on the m2eclipse plugin can be found here: http://m2eclipse.codehaus.org/
The m2eclipse page should have the update URL that you need to supply, please check that page for the needed info.
As of recently, there has been a problem with the normal build, if you are experiencing problems, try the developer build link.
You only need to install 2 things, from the Maven Integration branch: Maven Embedder and Maven Integration for Eclipse.

We also recommend downloading and installing the commandline version of Maven which is available at http://maven.apache.org/download.html.
Note: Currently, we recommend version 2.2.1. Furthermore, if you install the commandline version of Maven we also recommend you configure the Maven Eclipse plugin to use this version. This is accomplished via the Eclipe toolbar, Windows->Preferences->Maven->Installations. Once here, select "Add" and point to your commandline installation.
Instructions can be found here: http://testng.org/doc/eclipse.html
Instructions can be found here: http://www.eclipse.org/egit/
